Q: To make a lemonade mixture, you mix 3 liters of lemon concentrate with water to produce 12 liters of lemonade. How many liters of water do you need to add?
A:
completion:
Total lemonade = 12 liters, lemon concentrate = 3 liters.
Water needed = 12 − 3 = <<12-3=9>>9 liters.
#### 9

Q: A jacket originally costs $120. It is marked down by 25%, and then an additional 10% discount is applied to the sale price. What is the final price of the jacket?
A:
completion:
First discount: 25% of 120 = <<120*0.25=30>>30 dollars.
Price after first markdown = 120 − 30 = <<120-30=90>>90 dollars.
Second discount: 10% of 90 = <<90*0.10=9>>9 dollars.
Final price = 90 − 9 = <<90-9=81>>81 dollars.
#### 81

prompt:
Q: Three painters working together can paint a house in 6 hours. Two painters start and work for 2 hours before the third joins them. How many more hours will it take after the third painter arrives to finish the painting?
A:
completion:
Rate of three painters = 1 house / 6 hours = <<1/6=1/6>>1/6 house per hour.
Rate per painter = (1/6) / 3 = <<(1/6)/3=1/18>>1/18 house per hour.
Rate of two painters = 2 × (1/18) = <<2*(1/18)=1/9>>1/9 house per hour.
Work done in 2 hours by two painters = 2 × (1/9) = <<2*(1/9)=2/9>>2/9 houses.
Remaining work = 1 − 2/9 = <<1-2/9=7/9>>7/9 houses.
Rate of three painters = 3 × (1/18) = <<3*(1/18)=1/6>>1/6 house per hour.
Time to finish = (7/9) ÷ (1/6) = <<(7/9)/(1/6)=14/3>>14/3 hours.
#### 14/3
